com.aurel.track.fieldType.runtime.base

Interface IFieldTypeRT

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ILucene
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ICustomFieldTypeRT
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFieldTypeRT, CustomCalculatedBaseRT, CustomCheckBoxSingleRT, CustomCompositeBaseRT, CustomDateRT, CustomDoubleRT, CustomExtensibleSelectRT, CustomHTMLLabelRT, CustomIntegerRT, CustomLongTextRT, CustomOnePieceBaseRT, CustomPickerRT, CustomRichTextRT, CustomSelectBaseRT, CustomSelectParentChildGrandchildRT, CustomSelectParentChildrenRT, CustomSelectParentChildRT, CustomSelectSimpleRT, CustomShortTextRT, CustomTextBaseRT, CustomTextBoxBaseRT, CustomTreePickerRT, InputFieldTypeRT, ItemPickerRT, OnBehalfOfPickerRT, OutputFieldTypeRT, ProjectPickerRT, SystemAccessLevelRT, SystemArchiveLevelRT, SystemBuildRT, SystemCommentRT, SystemDateRT, SystemDescriptionRT, SystemDurationRT, SystemInputBaseRT, SystemIssueNoRT, SystemIssueTypeRT, SystemLabelDateRT, SystemLastEditedByRT, SystemLookupBaseRT, SystemManagerRT, SystemOriginatorRT, SystemOutputBaseRT, SystemParentRT, SystemPersonBaseRT, SystemPriorityRT, SystemProjectRT, SystemProjectSpecificIssueNoRT, SystemReleaseBaseRT, SystemReleaseNoticedRT, SystemReleaseScheduledRT, SystemResponsibleRT, SystemRichTextBaseRT, SystemSelectBaseLocalizedRT, SystemSelectBaseRT, SystemSeverityRT, SystemShortTextRT, SystemStateRT, SystemSubmitterEmailRT, SystemSynopsisRT, SystemTargetDurationRT, SystemTextBaseRT, SystemTextBoxBaseRT, SystemWBSRT, TaskIsMilestoneRT, UserPickerRT

    public interface IFieldTypeRT
extends ILucene
    Base interface for all fields (system and custom) defining their runtime behavior

      java.lang.Object getMatcherDataSource(IMatcherValue matcherValue, MatcherDatasourceContext matcherDatasourceContext, java.lang.Integer parameterCode)
      Loads the datasource for the matcher used by select fields to get the possible values It will be called from both field expressions and upper selects The value can be a list for simple select or a map of lists for composite selects or a tree
      java.lang.String getMatcherShowValue(java.lang.Integer fieldID, java.lang.Object value, java.util.Locale locale)
      Get the value to be shown for a matcher Typically same as for the getShowValue(), except the selects (the value object's type differs for matchers compared to issue field values in getShowValue)

      Parse the group value

      Get the ISO show value for locale independent exporting to xml typically same as show value, date and number values are formatted by iso format

      Get the show value called when an item result set is implied

      Get the show value when a single item is implied
      java.lang.String getShowValue(java.lang.Object value, WorkItemContext workItemContext, java.lang.Integer fieldID) 
      java.lang.Comparable getSortOrderValue(java.lang.Integer fieldID, java.lang.Integer parameterCode, java.lang.Object value, java.lang.Integer workItemID, LocalLookupContainer localLookupContainer)
      Get the sort order related to the value By default the value is directly used as sortOrder the select fields has extra sortOrder columns
      java.lang.String getStringGroupValue(java.lang.Object value)
      Gets the raw group value as a string
      java.lang.Integer getSystemOptionType()
      In case of a custom picker or system selects select the list type Used by saving custom pickers and explicit history for both system and custom fields
      int getValueType()
      Defines the data type of the field attribute Used by saving field attributes for custom fields and saving explicit history for both system and custom fields Should be a @ValueType constant
      boolean groupLabelDiffersFromShowValue()
      Whether the group label differs from the show value of the workItems from the same group It is needed to differentiate because for getting the label for group either the getGroupLabel() will be called or the reportBean.getShowValue(fieldID) method (not the fieldTypeRT's getShowValue(Object value, Locale locale) which is the default implementation for getGroupLabel() because the reportBean contains the showValue already, and calling the getShowValue(Object value, Locale locale) might result in unnecessary database access: see.
      boolean isComposite()
      Whether the field is composite
      boolean isComputed(java.lang.Integer fieldID, java.lang.Integer parameterCode)
      Whether this field is a custom label field
      boolean isCustom()
      Whether the field is a custom field
      boolean isGroupable()
      Whether the field should appear in the groupable fields list Typically fields which are typically unique should not be groupable
      boolean isLong()
      Whether this field is a long text because then the read only rendering (on the report overview, printItem, etc.)
      boolean isLookup()
      Whether the field is a lookup field (on list or tree based)
      boolean isMultipleValues()
      Defines whether there could be more values for the same parameterCode returns true typically for (multiple) selects
      boolean isoDiffersFromLocaleSpecific()
      Returns whether the iso show value differs from the locale specific show value for this field type.
      boolean isReadOnly()
      Whether the value of this field can be changed
      boolean isUserPicker()
      Whether this field is a UserPicker Special care should be taken by user pickers because of the notification (automail) A person may receive an automail just because he/she is selected in a userPicker
      void loadBulkOperationDataSource(MassOperationContext massOperationContext, MassOperationValue massOperationValue, java.lang.Integer parameterCode, TPersonBean personBean, java.util.Locale locale)
      Loads the datasource for the bulk operation used mainly by select fields to get the all possible options for a field (system or custom select) It also sets a value if not yet selected (Important by composite selects where the child should have access to the parent's value at any time) The value can be a List for simple select or a Map of lists for composite selects (this method was preferable to be part of the IBulkSetter interface but for composite parts the structural fields are needed.
      void loadFieldChangeDatasourceAndValue(WorkflowContext workflowContext, FieldChangeValue fieldChangeValue, java.lang.Integer parameterCode, TPersonBean personBean, java.util.Locale locale)
      Loads the datasource and value for configuring the field change
      boolean mightAppearOnForm()
      Whether the field can be rendered on a form
      boolean mightMatchExcelColumn()
      Whether the field can be matched in for an excel column

      Parses the string value into the corresponding object value

      Validates an attribute for a field and returns the resource key(s) in case of validation error

      • processLoadDataSource

        void processLoadDataSource(SelectContext selectContext,
                         DropDownContainer dropDownContainer)
        Actualizes the dropDownContainer with the datasource for a select type field by editing an existing issue/creating a new issue/refreshing a composite part. The result might differ depending on create flag because it might be needed to add the current value from the workItem explicitely to the list entries when the right was revoked for the current value. If the parameterCode of the selectContext is not null then the field is a part of a composite field and probably a refresh took place (not edit/create). In this case only the datasource of the composite part specified by paramaterCode will be reloaded, not for each part of the composite
        Parameters:
        selectContext -
        dropDownContainer -

      • procesLoadValidators

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<Validator>> procesLoadValidators(java.lang.Integer fieldID,
                                                                              TFieldConfigBean fieldConfigBean,

                                                                              java.lang.Object settingsObject,
                                                                              TWorkItemBean workItemBean)
        Validates an attribute for a field and returns the resource key(s) in case of validation error
        Parameters:

        fieldConfigBean -
        parameterCode -
        settingsObject - should be either TTextBoxSettingsBean, TOptionSettingsBean or TGeneralSettingsBean
        workItemBean - the value to validate
        Returns:

      • processLoadMatcherRT

        IMatcherRT processLoadMatcherRT(java.lang.Integer fieldID,
                              int relation,
                              java.lang.Object matchValue,
                              MatcherContext matcherContext)
        Loads the matcher object for executing the matcher fieldID would suffice as parameter for loading the specific Matcher, while the other parameters could be set after the matcher is loaded. But we need the matchValue parameter in the getMatcher() already set in case of replacement parameters, to replace the symbolic value with the actual value The symbolic and replacement values will be stored in the matcherContext (ex. $USER for the current user as originator/manager/responsible: the symbolic value for $USER should be replaced with the value of the user currently logged in)
        Parameters:
        fieldID -
        relation -
        matchValue -
        matcherContext -

        Get the converter used for matcher
        Returns:

      • getMatcherDataSource

        java.lang.Object getMatcherDataSource(IMatcherValue matcherValue,
                                    MatcherDatasourceContext matcherDatasourceContext,
                                    java.lang.Integer parameterCode)
        Loads the datasource for the matcher used by select fields to get the possible values It will be called from both field expressions and upper selects The value can be a list for simple select or a map of lists for composite selects or a tree
        Parameters:
        matcherValue -
        matcherDatasourceContext - the data source may be project dependent.
        parameterCode - for composite selects
        Returns:
        the datasource (list or tree)

      • loadBulkOperationDataSource

        void loadBulkOperationDataSource(MassOperationContext massOperationContext,
                               MassOperationValue massOperationValue,
                               java.lang.Integer parameterCode,
                               TPersonBean personBean,
                               java.util.Locale locale)
        Loads the datasource for the bulk operation used mainly by select fields to get the all possible options for a field (system or custom select) It also sets a value if not yet selected (Important by composite selects where the child should have access to the parent's value at any time) The value can be a List for simple select or a Map of lists for composite selects (this method was preferable to be part of the IBulkSetter interface but for composite parts the structural fields are needed. See CustomDependentSelect parentID childNumber)
        Parameters:
        massOperationContext -
        massOperationValue -
        parameterCode -
        personBean -
        locale -

        Returns:

      • isoDiffersFromLocaleSpecific

        boolean isoDiffersFromLocaleSpecific()
        Returns whether the iso show value differs from the locale specific show value for this field type. This is needed to avoid loading the iso values by repeating the load for locale specific show value (which takes surprisingly long time)
        Returns:

      • getSortOrderValue

        java.lang.Comparable getSortOrderValue(java.lang.Integer fieldID,
                                     java.lang.Integer parameterCode,
                                     java.lang.Object value,
                                     java.lang.Integer workItemID,
                                     LocalLookupContainer localLookupContainer)
        Get the sort order related to the value By default the value is directly used as sortOrder the select fields has extra sortOrder columns
        Parameters:
        fieldID -
        parameterCode -
        value - the value the sortorder is looked for
        workItemID -
        localLookupContainer -
        Returns:

      • isUserPicker

        boolean isUserPicker()
        Whether this field is a UserPicker Special care should be taken by user pickers because of the notification (automail) A person may receive an automail just because he/she is selected in a userPicker
        Returns:

      • isLong

        boolean isLong()
        Whether this field is a long text because then the read only rendering (on the report overview, printItem, etc.) should be made different as the rest of the "short" fields This can be the case for Description, Comment and longtext custom fields
        Returns:

      • isGroupable

        boolean isGroupable()
        Whether the field should appear in the groupable fields list Typically fields which are typically unique should not be groupable
        Returns:

        Parse the group value
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:

      • getGroupLabel

        java.lang.String getGroupLabel(java.lang.Object value,
                             java.util.Locale locale)
        Gets the label for the group. It is typically the same as the showValue() of the workItems from the same group, but it will be called only for fields for which groupLabelDiffersFromShowValue() returns true (For create/last modification date it should differ from the show showValue() because the time part of the date should be removed from the label for group)
        Returns:

      • groupLabelDiffersFromShowValue

        boolean groupLabelDiffersFromShowValue()
        Whether the group label differs from the show value of the workItems from the same group It is needed to differentiate because for getting the label for group either the getGroupLabel() will be called or the reportBean.getShowValue(fieldID) method (not the fieldTypeRT's getShowValue(Object value, Locale locale) which is the default implementation for getGroupLabel() because the reportBean contains the showValue already, and calling the getShowValue(Object value, Locale locale) might result in unnecessary database access: see. SystemSelectBase getLabelBean())
        Returns:

      • mightAppearOnForm

        boolean mightAppearOnForm()
        Whether the field can be rendered on a form
        Returns:

      • mightMatchExcelColumn

        boolean mightMatchExcelColumn()
        Whether the field can be matched in for an excel column
        Returns:
